name: parsimonious
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not willing to spend money or use a lot of something: She's too parsimonious to heat the house properly. I had to be a little parsimonious with the fresh thyme. I think that politicians are often parsimonious with the (= do not tell the complete) truth.
small in size or amount: The company produced figures ahead of expectations but spoiled it with a parsimonious 2.5% dividend increase.
More examplesFewer examplesEven the most parsimonious student who goes through university will enter the job market weighed down by debt.Parsimonious cooks will want to use the scraps of leftover pastry.Although he now had cinematic and musical ambitions, his primary goals were more parsimonious.One of the longstanding shortcomings of the operating system is the parsimonious 127-character limit it places on commands.
